repo.$comment: the repository url to git clone from

rev.$comment: the revision or tag to clone at (previously sha).

hooks.$comment: A list of hook mappings. See https://pre-commit.com/#pre-commit-configyaml---hooks.

id.$comment: which hook from the repository to use.

alias.$comment: (optional) allows the hook to be referenced using an additional id when using pre-commit run <hookid>.

name.$comment: (optional) override the name of the hook - shown during hook execution.

language.$comment: (optional) Tells pre-commit on how to install the hook. See https://pre-commit.com/#supported-languages

language_version.$comment: (optional) override the language version for the hook. See https://pre-commit.com/#overriding-language-version.

files.$comment: (optional) override the default pattern for files to run on.

entry.$comment: (optional) Override default command to execute for the hook.

types.$comment: (optional) override the default file types to run on. See https://pre-commit.com/#filtering-files-with-types.

types_or.$comment: (optional) override the default file types to run on (OR). See Filtering files with types. new in 2.9.0.

args.$comment: (optional) list of additional parameters to pass to the hook.

stages.$comment: (optional) confines the hook to the commit, merge-commit, push, prepare-commit-msg, commit-msg, post-checkout, post-commit or manual stage. See https://pre-commit.com/#confining-hooks-to-run-at-certain-stages.

additional_dependencies.$comment: (optional) a list of dependencies that will be installed in the environment where this hook gets run. One useful application is to install plugins for hooks such as eslint.

always_run.$comment: (optional) if true, this hook will run even if there are no matching files.

verbose.$comment: (optional) if true, forces the output of the hook to be printed even when the hook passes.

log_file.$comment: (optional) if present, the hook output will additionally be written to a file.

pass_filenames.$comment: (optional) if false, this hook will be called only once without being called for each matching file.

autofix_commit_msg.$comment: custom commit message for PR autofixes
autofix_commit_msg.default:
[pre-commit.ci] auto fixes from pre-commit.com hooks

for more information, see https://pre-commit.ci

autofix_prs.$comment: whether to autofix pull requests. when disabled, comment "pre-commit.ci autofix" on a pull request to manually trigger auto-fixing

autoupdate_branch.$comment: branch to send autoupdate PRs to. by default, pre-commit.ci will update the default branch of the repository.

autoupdate_commit_msg.$comment: custom commit message for autoupdate PRs

skip.$comment: which hook ids to be skipped when running under pre-commit.ci

submodules.$comment: whether to recursive check out submodules

repos.$comment: A list of repository mappings. See https://pre-commit.com/#pre-commit-configyaml---repos.

default_language_version.$comment: (optional: default {}) a mapping from language to the default language_version that should be used for that language. This will only override individual hooks that do not set language_version.

default_stages.$comment: (optional: default (all stages)) a configuration-wide default for the stages property of hooks. This will only override individual hooks that do not set stages.

fail_fast.$comment: (optional: default false) set to true to have pre-commit stop running hooks after the first failure.

minimum_pre_commit_version.$comment: (optional: default '0') require a minimum version of pre-commit.
